longDesc:
# @buildlog/openclaw-skill

Record, export, and share your AI coding sessions as replayable buildlogs.

[![npm version](https://badge.fury.io/js/@buildlog%2Fopenclaw-skill.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@buildlog/openclaw-skill)
[![ClawHub](https://img.shields.io/badge/ClawHub-buildlog-blue)](https://clawhub.io/skills/buildlog)
[![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT)

## Overview

The buildlog skill captures your OpenClaw AI-assisted coding sessions in real-time, creating replayable recordings that can be shared on [buildlog.ai](https://buildlog.ai).

Perfect for:
- üìö **Tutorials** ‚Äî Share how you built something step-by-step
- üìù **Documentation** ‚Äî Create living documentation of complex implementations
- üêõ **Debugging** ‚Äî Review sessions to understand what went wrong
- üéì **Learning** ‚Äî Study how others approach problems

## Installation

### From ClawHub (Recommended)

```bash
openclaw skill install buildlog
```

### From npm

```bash
npm install @buildlog/openclaw-skill
```

## Quick Start

Once installed, just talk to OpenClaw:

```
You: Start a buildlog "Building a REST API"
üî¥ Recording started: "Building a REST API"

You: Create an Express server with TypeScript
[OpenClaw creates files...]

You: Stop the buildlog
‚úÖ Recording stopped. 12 exchanges captured.
Would you like to upload to buildlog.ai?

You: Yes
‚úÖ Uploaded to buildlog.ai!
üîó https://buildlog.ai/b/abc123
```

## Commands

### Recording

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `Start a buildlog [title]` | Begin recording a new session |
| `Stop the buildlog` | End recording and optionally upload |
| `Pause the buildlog` | Temporarily pause recording |
| `Resume the buildlog` | Continue a paused recording |

### Exporting

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `Export this session as a buildlog` | Convert current session to buildlog format |
| `Export the last [N] messages` | Export a portion of the session |

### Uploading

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `Upload the buildlog` | Push to buildlog.ai |
| `Share the buildlog` | Upload and get a shareable link |

### Annotations

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `Add a note: [text]` | Add commentary to the current point |
| `Mark this as important` | Flag the current exchange |
| `Add chapter: [title]` | Create a chapter marker |

### Status

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `Buildlog status` | Check recording state |
| `Show buildlog info` | Display current recording details |

## Configuration

Add to your OpenClaw configuration file (`~/.openclaw/config.json`):

```json
{
  "skills": {
    "buildlog": {
      "apiKey": "your-api-key",
      "autoUpload": false,
      "defaultPublic": true,
      "includeFileContents": true,
      "maxFileSizeKb": 100
    }
  }
}
```

### Options

| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|--------|------|---------|-------------|
| `apiKey` | string | ‚Äî | Your buildlog.ai API key (optional for public uploads) |
| `autoUpload` | boolean | `false` | Automatically upload when recording stops |
| `defaultPublic` | boolean | `true` | Make buildlogs public by default |
| `includeFileContents` | boolean | `true` | Include file content snapshots |
| `maxFileSizeKb` | number | `100` | Maximum file size to include in buildlog |

## Programmatic Usage

You can also use the skill programmatically:

```typescript
import { 
  BuildlogRecorder, 
  BuildlogExporter, 
  BuildlogUploader 
} from '@buildlog/openclaw-skill';

// Create a recorder
const recorder = new BuildlogRecorder({
  includeFileContents: true,
  maxFileSizeKb: 100,
});

// Start recording
recorder.start('My Session');

// Handle events
recorder.handleEvent({
  type: 'user_message',
  timestamp: Date.now(),
  data: { content: 'Create a function...' },
});

// Stop and get buildlog
const session = recorder.stop();
const buildlog = recorder.toBuildlog();

// Upload
const uploader = new BuildlogUploader({ apiKey: 'your-key' });
const result = await uploader.upload(buildlog);

console.log('Uploaded:', result.url);
```

### Retroactive Export

Export an existing session history:

```typescript
import { BuildlogExporter } from '@buildlog/openclaw-skill';

const exporter = new BuildlogExporter({
  title: 'My Coding Session',
  tags: ['typescript', 'api'],
});

const buildlog = exporter.export(sessionHistory);
```

## Events

The skill emits the following events that you can subscribe to:

```typescript
skill.recorder.on('started', (event) => {
  console.log('Recording started:', event.data.title);
});

skill.recorder.on('stopped', (event) => {
  console.log('Recording stopped:', event.data.session);
});
```

| Event | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `buildlog:started` | Recording began |
| `buildlog:stopped` | Recording ended |
| `buildlog:paused` | Recording paused |
| `buildlog:resumed` | Recording resumed |
| `buildlog:uploaded` | Buildlog uploaded successfully |
| `buildlog:error` | An error occurred |

## API Reference

### BuildlogSkill

Main skill class for OpenClaw integration.

```typescript
const skill = createBuildlogSkill(config);
await skill.initialize(openClawContext);
const handled = await skill.handleMessage(ctx, 'start a buildlog');
skill.dispose();
```

### BuildlogRecorder

State machine for recording sessions.

```typescript
const recorder = new BuildlogRecorder(config);
recorder.start('Title');
recorder.handleEvent(event);
recorder.addNote('Important point');
recorder.addChapter('Setup');
recorder.pause();
recorder.resume();
const session = recorder.stop();
```

### BuildlogExporter

Convert session history to buildlog format.

```typescript
const exporter = new BuildlogExporter(options);
const buildlog = exporter.export(sessionHistory);
const partial = exporter.exportLastN(sessionHistory, 10);
```

### BuildlogUploader

Upload buildlogs to buildlog.ai.

```typescript
const uploader = new BuildlogUploader({ apiKey });
const result = await uploader.upload(buildlog, options);
const info = await uploader.getInfo(id);
await uploader.delete(id);
```

## Privacy

- üîí Buildlogs can be public or private
- üîë API keys are never included in exports
- üéõÔ∏è You control what gets shared
- üóëÔ∏è Delete buildlogs anytime at buildlog.ai

## Development

```bash
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Build
npm run build

# Run tests
npm test

# Watch mode
npm run dev
```

## Contributing

Contributions are welcome! Please read our [Contributing Guide](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details.

## License

MIT ¬© [buildlog.ai](https://buildlog.ai)

## Links

- [buildlog.ai](https://buildlog.ai) ‚Äî View and share buildlogs
- [Documentation](https://docs.buildlog.ai) ‚Äî Full documentation
- [ClawHub](https://clawhub.io/skills/buildlog) ‚Äî Skill registry listing
- [GitHub](https://github.com/buildlog/openclaw-skill) ‚Äî Source code

# OpenClaw Custom Skills ü¶û

This directory contains specialized skills tailored for this OpenClaw agent instance (**Â¶≤Â∑±**).
These skills define the agent's core capabilities, workflow standards, and integration with local tools.

## Skills List

### ü§ñ Development & Coding
- **[claude-code](./claude-code/SKILL.md)**:
  - Integrates Anthropic's `claude` CLI for autonomous coding.
  - Supports **Single-Shot (`-p`)** and **Interactive** modes.
  - Implements **OpenSpec (SDD)** workflow for rigorous spec-driven development.
  - Features JSON output parsing and Wake Event auto-notification.

- **[coding-workflow](./coding-workflow/SKILL.md)**:
  - Defines the strict "Plan ‚Üí Implement ‚Üí Test ‚Üí Report" SOP.
  - Enforces Kanban updates and smoke testing.
  - Provides helper scripts for parallel development.

### üß† Decision Making
- **[model-priority](./model-priority/SKILL.md)**:
  - Logic for selecting the best AI model (GPT-5.2 vs Claude 3.5 vs Gemini) based on task type.
  - Handles fallback strategies and quota management.

- **[pm-orchestrator](./pm-orchestrator/SKILL.md)**:
  - Acts as a Project Manager to break down large user requests.
  - Assigns sub-tasks to sub-agents or specific tools.

### üõ† Operations
- **[kanban-ops](./kanban-ops/SKILL.md)**:
  - Tools for managing the local `project-kanban` service (port 3001).
  - Supports database backups, status checks, and data migration.

## Usage
These skills are automatically loaded by OpenClaw. The agent refers to them to determine *how* to execute complex requests (e.g., "Use Claude to fix this bug" -> loads `claude-code`).

shortDesc: Ëá™Âä®ËøúÁ®ãÂÆâË£Öopenclaw
longDesc:
# openclaw-remote-bootstrap-openclaw-skill

Bootstrap **OpenClaw** on a remote server over SSH (Linux or macOS): install the OpenClaw CLI, run `openclaw onboard` in **non-interactive** mode, optionally install the daemon (systemd/launchd), then run basic health checks.

This repo is primarily intended to be used as an OpenClaw **skill**.

## Contents

- `SKILL.md` ‚Äî skill metadata + how to use
- `scripts/remote_bootstrap.sh` ‚Äî the actual SSH bootstrap script

## Quick start

From the machine where you have SSH access to the target server:

```bash
# Example: Anthropic API key auth
export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY="..."

bash skills/openclaw-remote-bootstrap/scripts/remote_bootstrap.sh \
  --host user@server.example.com \
  --port 22 \
  --identity ~/.ssh/id_ed25519 \
  --auth-choice apiKey \
  --gateway-port 18789 \
  --gateway-bind loopback
```

### Supported auth examples

- `--auth-choice apiKey` + `--anthropic-api-key ...` (or `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` env)
- `--auth-choice gemini-api-key` + `--gemini-api-key ...` (or `GEMINI_API_KEY` env)
- `--auth-choice synthetic-api-key` + `--synthetic-api-key ...` (or `SYNTHETIC_API_KEY` env)

For other auth modes, run `openclaw onboard --help` on the target and extend the script accordingly.

## What it does

1. SSH to the target
2. Detect OS (`Linux`/`Darwin`) and ensure `curl` exists
3. Install OpenClaw CLI via:
   - preferred: `curl -fsSL https://openclaw.bot/install.sh | bash`
   - fallback: `npm install -g openclaw@latest`
4. Run:

```bash
openclaw onboard --non-interactive --mode local \
  --auth-choice ... \
  --gateway-port ... \
  --gateway-bind ... \
  --install-daemon --daemon-runtime node \
  --skip-skills
```

5. Verify:

```bash
openclaw gateway status
openclaw status
openclaw health
```

## Security notes

- Default is `--gateway-bind loopback` to avoid exposing the control UI/network surface.
- Do **not** paste API keys into chat logs. Prefer environment variables.
- If you must expose the gateway externally, use a VPN/Tailscale or a properly configured reverse proxy.

## License

TBD (pick one before wider distribution: MIT/Apache-2.0 recommended).

# OpenClaw Skills Directory A comprehensive directory website showcasing 700+ skills for OpenClaw AI agents. Built for discoverability, SEO, and Generative Engine Optimization (GEO). ## ü¶û Overview The OpenClaw Skills Directory helps developers and AI enthusiasts discover, install, and contribute skills that extend OpenClaw agent capabilities. Skills are community-built extensions that teach AI agents how to interact with tools, services, and workflows. ## üìÅ Structure ``` openclaw-skills/ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.html # Main directory page ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ sitemap.xml # XML sitemap for search engines ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ robots.txt # Crawler directives ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md # This file ``` ## ‚ú® Features ### SEO Optimization - Semantic HTML5 structure - Meta tags (title, description, Open Graph, Twitter Cards) - JSON-LD schema markup (CollectionPage, ItemList) - Canonical URLs - Mobile-responsive design ### GEO Optimization (Generative Engine Optimization) - Clear, natural language descriptions - Structured data for AI understanding - Installation instructions inline - Use cases for each skill - Category-based organization ### Functionality - **Search**: Filter skills by name, description, or category - **Categories**: Browse by Productivity, Development, Research, Communication, Automation, Data - **One-click install**: Copy `npx clawdhub install ` commands - **GitHub links**: Direct access to source code - **Newsletter signup**: Stay updated on new skills - **Submit/Sponsor CTAs**: Community contribution pathways ## üõ†Ô∏è Skills Categories | Category | Count | Examples | |----------|-------|----------| | Productivity | 42 | Apple Reminders, Linear, Deepwork Tracker | | Development | 65 | GitHub, Vercel, Coding Agent, Conventional Commits | | Research | 23 | Brave Search, Exa, Tavily, ArXiv Watcher | | Communication | 26 | Slack, Discord, Tweet Writer | | Automation | 52 | Agent Browser, Playwright, Cloudflare Workers | | Data | 29 | Supabase, Bright Data, Fal.ai | ## üöÄ Installation Methods ### Via ClawdHub CLI (Recommended) ```bash npx clawdhub@latest install ``` ### Manual Installation Copy the skill folder to: - **Global**: `~/.openclaw/skills/` - **Workspace**: `/skills/` Priority: Workspace > Local > Bundled ## üìö Resources - **OpenClaw Docs**: https://docs.openclaw.ai/tools/skills - **ClawdHub Registry**: https://clawdhub.com - **GitHub Organization**: https://github.com/openclaw - **Awesome List**: https://github.com/VoltAgent/awesome-openclaw-skills ## üîß Development The directory is a static HTML site optimized for fast loading and easy deployment. No build step required. ### Local Preview ```bash cd directories/openclaw-skills python -m http.server 8080 # or npx serve . ``` ### Deploy Deploy to any static hosting: - Vercel - Netlify - Cloudflare Pages - GitHub Pages ## üìù Adding Skills To add a skill to the directory: 1. Ensure the skill is published to ClawdHub 2. Edit `index.html` 3. Add a new skill card in the appropriate category section 4. Include: name, description, author, install command, GitHub link ### Skill Card Template ```html
Skill Name
Category

Description of what the skill does.

üë§ author ‚≠ê Popular
npx clawdhub install skill-slug
üìÇ Source
``` ## ü§ù Contributing - **Submit a skill**: https://github.com/openclaw/clawhub - **Report issues**: Open an issue in this repository - **Suggest improvements**: PRs welcome! ## üìÑ License MIT License - feel free to use, modify, and distribute. --- Built with ü¶û for the OpenClaw community.

longDesc:
# openclaw-skills

A collection of skills for [Clawdbot](https://github.com/clawdbot/clawdbot) - the extensible AI assistant.

## Table of Contents

- [Skills](#skills)
- [Installation](#installation)
  - [Option 1: Install Single Skill](#option-1-install-single-skill)
  - [Option 2: Install Multiple Skills](#option-2-install-multiple-skills)
  - [Option 3: Sparse Checkout](#option-3-sparse-checkout-download-only-what-you-need)
- [Using with Clawdbot](#using-with-clawdbot)
  - [How It Works](#how-it-works)
  - [Example Usage](#example-usage)
  - [Telling Your Agent About New Skills](#telling-your-agent-about-new-skills)
- [Development](#development)
- [Contributing](#contributing)
- [License](#license)
- [Credits](#credits)

## Skills

| Skill | Description | Status |
|-------|-------------|--------|
| [bahn](./bahn/) | Deutsche Bahn delays, connections, prices, and Bahncard discounts | ‚úÖ Stable |

## Installation

### Option 1: Install Single Skill

```bash
git clone https://github.com/jjannix/openclaw-skills.git
cd openclaw-skills
cp -r bahn ~/clawd/skills/
cd .. && rm -rf openclaw-skills
```

### Option 2: Install Multiple Skills

```bash
git clone https://github.com/jjannix/openclaw-skills.git
cd openclaw-skills
cp -r bahn weather github ~/clawd/skills/
cd .. && rm -rf openclaw-skills
```

### Option 3: Sparse Checkout (Download Only What You Need)

```bash
git clone --no-checkout https://github.com/jjannix/openclaw-skills.git
cd openclaw-skills
git sparse-checkout set bahn
git checkout
mv bahn ~/clawd/skills/
cd .. && rm -rf openclaw-skills
```

## Using with Clawdbot

Once installed, your Clawdbot agent can use these skills immediately. The agent will automatically discover skills in its workspace and use them based on the skill descriptions in each `SKILL.md` file.

### How It Works

1. **Skill Discovery** - Clawdbot scans the `~/clawd/skills/` directory on startup
2. **Automatic Loading** - Each `SKILL.md` file provides instructions for the agent
3. **Context-Aware** - The agent uses skills when your requests match their descriptions

### Example Usage

After installing the `bahn` skill:

**You:** "Is the ICE 801 from Berlin to Munich on time?"

**Agent:** [Uses bahn skill to check real-time delays]

**You:** "What's the ticket price from Berlin to Munich?"

**Agent:** [Uses bahn skill to check pricing via journeys endpoint]

**You:** "How much with Bahncard 25?"

**Agent:** [Uses bahn skill with Bahncard discount]

### Telling Your Agent About New Skills

If you've installed a new skill and your agent doesn't seem to be using it, you can explicitly tell your agent:

```
"I've installed the bahn skill in ~/clawd/skills/bahn/. You can now check Deutsche Bahn train delays, connections, ticket prices, and Bahncard discounts."
```

Your agent will read the skill's `SKILL.md` and know how to use it.

## Development

Each skill is self-contained with its own:
- `SKILL.md` - Documentation and usage instructions
- `scripts/` - Example scripts and utilities
- `references/` - API documentation and references

## Contributing

Contributions welcome! Please feel free to submit a Pull Request.

## License

MIT License - see [LICENSE](./LICENSE) for details.

## Credits

Built for the [Clawdbot](https://github.com/clawdbot/clawdbot) community.

## üöÄ Âø´ÈÄüÂÆâË£Ö

## üìñ ËØ¶ÁªÜ‰ΩøÁî®ËØ¥Êòé

### 1. üåç browser-useÔºà‰∫ëÁ´ØÊµèËßàÂô®Ôºâ

### 2. üåê browser-cashÔºàÂåøÂêçÊµèËßàÂô®Ôºâ

longDesc:
# openclaw-skills

A curated hub of **OpenClaw/Clawdbot skills** built by **@lalotrage**.

## Skills

### 1) cursor-openclaw (FREE)
Turn Cursor Agent CLI into an OpenClaw/Clawdbot-capable workflow runner (debug/refactor/tests).  
Repo: https://github.com/lalotrage/cursor-openclaw

### 2) polymarket-scanner (read-only)
Read-only Polymarket Gamma API scanner with `table/json/jsonl` outputs + simple placeholder edge calculation.  
Repo: https://github.com/lalotrage/polymarket-scanner

## Principles (non-negotiable)
- No secrets in repos (no tokens, cookies, auth.json, .env)
- BYO credentials via env vars when needed
- Prefer read-only + public endpoints unless explicitly required

## Roadmap
- Add more publish-safe skills (UFC analytics, payments/USDC tooling, automations)
- Optional: mirror paid versions to marketplace (x402/USDC)

longDesc:
# openclaw-skills

A collection of skills for [OpenClaw](https://openclaw.ai/).

## What's Inside

This repository contains skills that extend OpenClaw's capabilities:

- **opencode** - Use OpenCode for AI-powered code generation and development tasks. Build and edit projects, write code across multiple languages, and perform complex coding tasks.

- **mkstack** - Create and build Nostr client websites using the MKStack template. Quickly scaffold Nostr-powered web applications with React, Vite, Tailwind CSS, and pre-built Nostr integration.

## Usage

Skills can be loaded and used by OpenClaw agents.

## Contributing

Contributions are welcome! Feel free to submit pull requests with new skills or improvements to existing ones.

## License

See [LICENSE](LICENSE) for details.

name: Openclaw Skills
shortDesc: An OpenClaw skill by Naddotfun.
longDesc:
# OpenClaw Skills

Public repository of skills for [OpenClaw](https://github.com/openclaw) ‚Äî AI agent skills for blockchain interactions.

## Structure

Each top-level directory is a provider. Each subdirectory within a provider is an installable skill containing a `SKILL.md` and other skill related files.

```
openclaw-skills/
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ nadfun/
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ skills/
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ trading.md
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ create.md
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ quote.md
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ token.md
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ indexer.md
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agent-api.md
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wallet.md
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ausd.md
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ abi.md
```

## Install Instructions

Give OpenClaw the URL to this repo and it will let you choose which skill to install.

```
https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw-skills
```

## Available Skills

| Provider                  | Skill             | Description                                                                                                    |
| ------------------------- | ----------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [nadfun](https://nad.fun) | [nadfun](nadfun/) | Monad blockchain token launchpad with bonding curves. Trade tokens, launch your own, monitor events with viem. |

## Contributing

We welcome community contributions! Here's how to add your own skill:

### Adding a New Skill

1. **Fork this repository** and create a new branch for your skill.

2. **Create a provider directory** (if it doesn't exist):
   ```
   mkdir your-provider-name/
   ```

3. **Add the required files**:
   - `SKILL.md` ‚Äî The main skill definition file (required)
   - `skills/` ‚Äî Supporting skill modules (optional)

4. **Follow the structure**:
   ```
   your-provider-name/
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md
   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ skills/
       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ your-skill.md
   ```

5. **Submit a Pull Request** with a clear description of your skill.

### Guidelines

- Keep skill definitions clear and well-documented
- Include examples of usage in your `SKILL.md`
- Test your skill before submitting
- Use descriptive commit messages

longDesc:
# OpenClaw Skills

Custom skills for Claude Code CLI that extend AI capabilities with crypto trading, research, and data analysis.

## Skills

### DROYD

AI-powered crypto trading and research agent via natural language.

**Capabilities:**
- Agent chat (research, trading, data analysis)
- Content search (semantic and recent modes)
- Project discovery (by name, symbol, address, or concept)
- Project filtering (market cap, momentum, technical indicators)
- Watchlist management
- Autonomous trading with stop losses, take profits, and quant-based strategies

**Supported Chains:** Solana (trading + research)

[View DROYD Documentation](droyd/SKILL.md)

## Installation

### Prerequisites

- [Claude Code CLI](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code)
- `curl` and `jq` installed

### Install a Skill

```bash
# Install from GitHub
claude skill install github:your-username/openclaw-skills/droyd
```

Or manually:

```bash
# Clone the repo
git clone https://github.com/your-username/openclaw-skills.git

# Install the skill
claude skill install ./openclaw-skills/droyd.skill
```

## Configuration

Each skill requires API credentials. After installation, configure your API key:

```bash
mkdir -p ~/.clawdbot/skills/droyd
cat > ~/.clawdbot/skills/droyd/config.json << 'EOF'
{
  "apiKey": "YOUR_API_KEY_HERE",
  "apiUrl": "https://api.droyd.ai"
}
EOF
```

Get your API key at [droyd.ai](https://droyd.ai).

## Usage

Once installed, use natural language to invoke skills:

```
> Search for recent DeFi news on Solana

> Find trending micro-cap tokens with high momentum

> Research the top AI agent protocols

> Open a position on project X with 10% stop loss
```

## Directory Structure

```
openclaw-skills/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ droyd.skill              # Packaged skill
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ droyd/
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md             # Skill documentation
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ references/          # API reference docs
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agent-chat.md
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ project-filter.md
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ project-search.md
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ search.md
    ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ trading.md
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ scripts/             # API wrapper scripts
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ droyd.sh
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ droyd-chat.sh
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ droyd-filter.sh
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ droyd-positions.sh
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ droyd-project-search.sh
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ droyd-search.sh
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ droyd-trade-manage.sh
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ droyd-trade-open.sh
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ droyd-watchlist.sh
```

## Contributing

1. Fork this repository
2. Create a new skill directory following the structure above
3. Include `SKILL.md` with frontmatter and documentation
4. Add reference docs in `references/`
5. Add executable scripts in `scripts/`
6. Submit a pull request

## License

MIT

longDesc:
# OpenClaw Skills

A community-driven collection of skills for [OpenClaw](https://openclaw.ai) agents.

## What are Skills?

Skills are modular abilities that teach OpenClaw agents new capabilities. Each skill contains:
- `SKILL.md` - Instructions and API documentation for agents
- `_meta.json` - Skill metadata

## Available Skills

| Skill | Description | Author |
|-------|-------------|--------|
| [capminal](./capminal) | Interact with Cap Wallet via Capminal API | AndreaPN |

## Installation

### Via OpenClaw Chat
```
install this skill: https://github.com/Capminal/openclaw-skills/tree/main/capminal
```

### Manual Installation
```bash
git clone https://github.com/Capminal/openclaw-skills.git
cp -r openclaw-skills/capminal ~/.openclaw/skills/
```

## Contributing

We welcome contributions! To add a new skill:

1. **Fork** this repository
2. **Create** a new folder for your skill: `your-skill-name/`
3. **Add** required files:
   ```
   your-skill-name/
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md        # Required: Instructions for agents
   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ _meta.json      # Required: Metadata
   ```
4. **Submit** a Pull Request

### SKILL.md Template

```markdown
---
name: Your Skill Name
description: What your skill does
version: 1.0.0
author: YourName
tags: [tag1, tag2]
---

# Your Skill Name

Description of what this skill does.

## Authentication & Security

Instructions for handling API keys securely.

## API Endpoints

### Endpoint Name

**Request:**
\```bash
curl -X GET "https://api.example.com/endpoint" \
  -H "API_KEY: YOUR_API_KEY"
\```

**Example Response:**
\```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {}
}
\```

## Usage Instructions

Step-by-step instructions for agents.

## Error Handling

How to handle common errors.
```

### _meta.json Template

```json
{
  "owner": "your-username",
  "package": "your-skill-name",
  "displayName": "Your Skill Name",
  "latestRelease": {
    "version": "1.0.0",
    "publishedAt": 1234567890000
  }
}
```

## Guidelines

- Keep skills focused on a single purpose
- Include clear API documentation with examples
- Always instruct agents to secure API keys
- Ask users for missing credentials
- Test your skill before submitting

# OpenClaw Skills

Custom skills for [OpenClaw](https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw) ‚Äî the open-source AI agent framework.

## Skills

### üõí Lightspeed POS (`lightspeed/`)

Query inventory, sales, and products from Lightspeed R-Series retail POS.

```bash
python3 lightspeed/cli.py shops          # List locations
python3 lightspeed/cli.py sales --today  # Today's sales
python3 lightspeed/cli.py search "Liga"  # Search products
python3 lightspeed/cli.py inventory --brand "Padron" --zeros  # Zero inventory
```

**Features:**
- OAuth token management with auto-refresh
- Sales reports by day/week/month
- Inventory by location and brand
- Product search

### üìß Apple Mail (`apple-mail/`)

Read and send emails via Apple Mail using AppleScript (macOS only).

```bash
python3 apple-mail/cli.py list           # Recent emails
python3 apple-mail/cli.py unread         # Unread count
python3 apple-mail/cli.py search "invoice"
python3 apple-mail/cli.py send --to "x@y.com" --subject "Hi" --body "Hello"
```

**Features:**
- List mailboxes and emails
- Read full email content
- Search by sender/subject/content
- Send and reply to emails

## Installation

1. Clone this repo into your OpenClaw skills directory:
```bash
cd ~/clawd/skills
git clone https://github.com/perrykleese/openclaw-skills.git
```

2. Or copy individual skills:
```bash
cp -r openclaw-skills/lightspeed ~/clawd/skills/
```

## Requirements

- **Lightspeed:** API credentials (OAuth client ID/secret)
- **Apple Mail:** macOS with Mail.app configured

## License

MIT

longDesc:
# OpenClaw Skills

A collection of OpenClaw skills for job search, content creation, and automation.

## Skills

| Skill | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| **job-tracker** | Manage job application tracker (docx CRUD) |
| **job-roles** | Discover roles at companies (career page search) |
| **cover-letter** | Write tailored cover letters |
| **job-apply** | Browser automation for job applications |
| **referral-ask** | Generate referral request messages |
| **blog-writer** | Write and publish blog posts |
| **twitter-voice** | Generate tweets from daily work + trends |

## Usage

1. Copy skills to your OpenClaw workspace:
   ```bash
   cp -r <skill-name> ~/.openclaw/workspace/skills/
   ```

2. Replace placeholders with your actual values (see below)

3. Skills will appear in OpenClaw after restart

## Placeholders

These skills use placeholders for personal data. Replace with your own values:

| Placeholder | Description |
|-------------|-------------|
| `${HOME}` | Your home directory |
| `${WORKSPACE}` | OpenClaw workspace path |
| `${JOBS_DIR}` | Directory for job search files |
| `${EMAIL}` | Primary email address |
| `${EMAIL_ALT}` | Secondary email address |
| `${PHONE}` | Phone number |
| `${FULL_NAME}` | Full legal name |
| `${FIRST_NAME}` | First name |
| `${LAST_NAME}` | Last name |
| `${LINKEDIN_HANDLE}` | LinkedIn username |
| `${GITHUB_HANDLE}` | GitHub username |
| `${CURRENT_COMPANY}` | Current employer |
| `${UNIVERSITY}` | University name |
| `${LOCATION}` | City, State, Country |
| `${LOCATION_SHORT}` | City, State |
| `${VISA_STATUS}` | Work authorization details |
| `${NAME_PRONUNCIATION}` | Name pronunciation guide |
| `${RESUME_FILE}` | Resume filename |
| `${TRACKER_FILE}` | Job tracker filename |

## Shared Data

The `job-data/profile.json` file contains shared profile information used across job search skills. Update this file once, and all skills reference it.

## Blog Post

These skills are documented in detail: [Refactoring Skills: From Monolith to Modular](https://rkethamakka.github.io/blog/post.html?p=refactoring-skills-monolith-to-modular)

## License

MIT ‚Äî fork, adapt, make it yours.

# OpenClaw Skills Collection

A curated collection of custom skills for OpenClaw - AI automation, monitoring, and productivity tools.

## üöÄ Featured Skills

### AI Trend Monitor
Unified AI trend monitoring across multiple sources - arXiv, Hugging Face, Reddit, Hacker News, GitHub, and Nitter.

- **Path**: `skills/ai-trend-monitor/`
- **Features**: 
  - 6 data sources (arXiv, HuggingFace, Reddit, HN, GitHub, Nitter)
  - Dynamic hot topics from hot-topic-vocabulary skill
  - 7-day freshness filtering
  - Balanced scoring across platforms
  - WhatsApp summaries with TOP 10 trends
- **Status**: ‚úÖ Ready

### AI Trend Analyzer
Deep analysis of AI trend monitoring results. Generates comprehensive markdown reports with insights and predictions.

- **Path**: `skills/ai-trend-analyzer/`
- **Features**:
  - Parses data from ai-trend-monitor
  - Deep analysis of each hotspot
  - Overall trend identification
  - Professional markdown reports
  - Auto-sync to user folder
- **Status**: ‚úÖ Ready

### Daily Papers X
Automatically fetch and summarize trending AI papers from arXiv and Hugging Face with enhanced selection strategy.

- **Path**: `skills/daily-papers-x/`
- **Features**:
  - Top 20 selection with category enforcement (5 AI&LLM + 5 Embodied AI min)
  - 30 arXiv categories across 6 research directions
  - 1 Top Pick + 4 Featured papers for WhatsApp
  - Full markdown report with all 20 papers
  - Auto-sync to user folder
- **Status**: ‚úÖ Ready

### Hot Topic Vocabulary
Dynamic hot topic vocabulary analyzer - updates daily with emerging AI/tech keywords.

- **Path**: `skills/hot-topic-vocabulary/`
- **Features**:
  - NLP-based keyword extraction
  - 10-category classification
  - Auto-updates AI Trend Monitor
  - Cron-scheduled runs (daily at 12:00)
- **Status**: ‚úÖ Ready

### Beautiful Mermaid
Render Mermaid diagrams as beautiful SVGs or ASCII art. Supports flowcharts, state diagrams, sequence diagrams, class diagrams, ER diagrams with 15+ professional themes.

- **Path**: `skills/beautiful-mermaid/`
- **Features**: 
  - 15+ themes (Tokyo Night, Dracula, Catppuccin, Nord, etc.)
  - SVG and ASCII output formats
  - Multiple diagram types support
  - Auto-installation
- **Status**: ‚úÖ Ready

## üì¶ Installation

### Step 1: Clone Repository
```bash
git clone https://github.com/icetomoyo/openclaw-skills.git
cd openclaw-skills
```

### Step 2: Configure Environment
```bash
# Copy the example config file
cp .env.example .env

# Edit .env and set your sync folder path
# SYNC_FOLDER_PATH=/path/to/your/sync/folder
```

### Step 3: Configure Sync Folder (Optional)
Some skills auto-sync reports to a user folder. Set this in your `.env` file:

```bash
SYNC_FOLDER_PATH=/Users/yourname/Downloads/sync/Dir4Openclaw
```

**Note**: The `.env` file is gitignored and will NOT be uploaded to the repository.

### Method 2: Install Individual Skills
```bash
# Copy skill to your OpenClaw skills directory
cp -r skills/ai-trend-monitor /path/to/your/clawd/skills/
cp -r skills/daily-papers-x /path/to/your/clawd/skills/
```

## üõ†Ô∏è Creating New Skills

See [SKILL_TEMPLATE.md](SKILL_TEMPLATE.md) for creating your own skills.

## üìÅ Project Structure

```
openclaw-skills/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ skills/                       # All skills (managed)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ai-trend-monitor/        # AI trend monitoring (6 sources)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ai-trend-analyzer/       # Deep trend analysis & reports
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ daily-papers-x/          # AI papers curator
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ hot-topic-vocabulary/    # Dynamic vocabulary
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ beautiful-mermaid/       # Diagram renderer
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ releases/                     # Packaged .skill files
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .gitignore                    # Privacy protection
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md                     # This file

# Local-only skills (not in version control)
# - skills/agent-browser/        # Browser automation
# - skills/asuna_companion/      # Personal companion
```

## üîí Privacy & Security

- **Chrome profiles**: `.chrome-profile*` directories are excluded from git
- **Credentials**: All tokens, keys, and secrets are gitignored
- **Local data**: Output files and cache are not synced
- **Sync folder**: Reports auto-sync to `/Users/icetomoyo/Downloads/ÂêåÊ≠•Á©∫Èó¥/Dir4Openclaw/`

See `.gitignore` for full list of excluded files.

longDesc:
# OpenClaw Skills & Plugins

A collection of OpenClaw plugins and skills for extending AI assistant capabilities.

## Plugins

### YNAB Budget Manager

A comprehensive YNAB (You Need A Budget) integration plugin.

**Location:** `plugins/ynab-budget-manager/`

**Features:**
- List budgets and select which to use
- View accounts, transactions, categories, and monthly summaries
- Categorize transactions (optional, opt-in)
- Track credit card payment readiness
- Multiple review modes for transaction management
- Safety-first: write operations default to dry-run

**Quick Start:**

1. Generate a YNAB Personal Access Token at [app.ynab.com](https://app.ynab.com) ‚Üí Account Settings ‚Üí Developer Settings

2. Configure the plugin in `~/.openclaw/openclaw.json`:

```json
{
  "plugins": {
    "entries": {
      "ynab-budget-manager": {
        "enabled": true,
        "config": {
          "ynabToken": "your-token-here",
          "writeToolsEnabled": true
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

3. Install and build:

```bash
cd plugins/ynab-budget-manager
npm install
npm run build
```

4. Use the skill:

```
/ynab-budget-manager

> What transactions need to be categorized?
> How are my credit cards looking?
> Show me my spending this month
```

See [plugins/ynab-budget-manager/README.md](plugins/ynab-budget-manager/README.md) for full documentation.

## Configuration

### Environment Variables

For sensitive values like API tokens, you can use environment variables:

```bash
export YNAB_API_TOKEN="your-token-here"
```

Then reference in config:

```json
{
  "plugins": {
    "entries": {
      "ynab-budget-manager": {
        "enabled": true,
        "config": {
          "ynabToken": "${YNAB_API_TOKEN}"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

### State and Logs

Plugins store state in `~/.ynab-logs/` by default (configurable per plugin):

```
~/.ynab-logs/
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ state.json          # Plugin state (selected budget, sync state, etc.)
```

## Development

### Project Structure

```
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ plugins/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ynab-budget-manager/    # TypeScript plugin
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ openclaw.plugin.json
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tsconfig.json
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.ts
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/
‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ types.ts
‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ client.ts
‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ state.ts
‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ review.ts
‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ credit-cards.ts
‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tools/
‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ utils/
‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ skills/
‚îÇ           ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ynab-budget-manager/
‚îÇ               ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
```

### Building Plugins

```bash
cd plugins/ynab-budget-manager
npm install
npm run build
```

### Testing

```bash
npm test
```

## Security

- Never commit API tokens to git
- Use environment variables for sensitive configuration
- Plugins that modify data default to dry-run mode
- Review plugin permissions before enabling write operations

## License

MIT

| **database-operations** | Database design, migrations, and SQL optimization | Adapted from [buildwithclaude](https://github.com/davepoon/buildwithclaude) |
| **docker-essentials** | Docker commands and container management | [ClawHub](https://clawhub.ai) |
| **dotnet-expert** | .NET 8/9, ASP.NET Core, EF Core, CQRS patterns | Custom |
| **elevenlabs-voices** | Voice synthesis with ElevenLabs API | [ClawHub](https://clawhub.ai) |
| **git-essentials** | Git commands and workflows | [ClawHub](https://clawhub.ai) |
| **moltbook-interact** | Moltbook social network interaction | [ClawHub](https://clawhub.ai) |
| **moltbook-registry** | Moltbook identity registry | [ClawHub](https://clawhub.ai) |
| **nextjs-expert** | Next.js 15 App Router specialist | Adapted from [buildwithclaude](https://github.com/davepoon/buildwithclaude) |
| **postgres** | PostgreSQL management and monitoring | [ClawHub](https://clawhub.ai) |
| **react-expert** | React 18+ components, hooks, and Server Components | [ClawHub](https://clawhub.ai) |
| **security-auditor** | Security auditing and OWASP Top 10 | Adapted from [buildwithclaude](https://github.com/davepoon/buildwithclaude) |
| **shadcn-ui** | shadcn/ui components and Tailwind patterns | Custom |
| **sonoscli** | Sonos speaker control | [ClawHub](https://clawhub.ai) |
| **typescript-pro** | Advanced TypeScript type systems and patterns | [ClawHub](https://clawhub.ai) |
| **vercel-react-best-practices** | React/Next.js performance optimization | [ClawHub](https://clawhub.ai) |

## Credits

Several skills were adapted from **[Dave Poon](https://github.com/davepoon)**'s excellent [buildwithclaude](https://github.com/davepoon/buildwithclaude) collection (MIT licensed):

- code-reviewer
- database-operations
- nextjs-expert
- security-auditor

Thank you Dave! üôå

## License

Custom skills are MIT licensed. Installed/adapted skills retain their original licenses.

longDesc:
# SkillClaw ‚Äî OpenClaw Skill

> A skill that builds skills. AI-powered skill generation with on-chain USDC monetization.

## Install

```bash
openclaw skill install skillclaw
```

## Commands

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `forge:create` | Describe a skill in English ‚Üí get generated code |
| `forge:publish` | Publish to on-chain marketplace with USDC pricing |
| `forge:browse` | Discover skills other agents created |
| `forge:install` | Purchase a skill ‚Äî 95% to creator, 5% platform |

## Smart Contracts

Includes Solidity source for the on-chain marketplace:

- **SkillMarketplace** (`contracts/src/SkillMarketplace.sol`) ‚Äî Publish, install, update, enable/disable skills
- **RoyaltyDistributor** (`contracts/src/RoyaltyDistributor.sol`) ‚Äî 95/5 royalty split with pull-pattern withdrawals

Deployed on Base Sepolia. See [references/architecture.md](references/architecture.md) for addresses.

## CLI & SDK

```bash
npx skillforge-cli --help   # CLI
npm i skillforge-sdk          # TypeScript SDK
```

## Links

- **Live**: https://skillclaw.xyz
- **API**: https://backend-production-da4c.up.railway.app
- **Docs**: [references/architecture.md](references/architecture.md)

## USDC Hackathon

Built for the USDC Hackathon ‚Äî SmartContract track. Novel on-chain skill marketplace with USDC royalty distribution.

## License

MIT

longDesc:
# Clawdbot Skills

A collection of skills for [Clawdbot](https://github.com/clawdbot/clawdbot) agents.

## Skills

| Skill | Description | Status |
|-------|-------------|--------|
| [ynab](./ynab/) | YNAB budget tracking ‚Äî check balances, transactions, categories | ‚úÖ Ready |

## Installation

```bash
# Install a skill from ClawHub
clawdbot skills install <skill-name>

# Or clone this repo and link manually
git clone https://github.com/youruser/clawdbot-skills.git
clawdbot skills link ./clawdbot-skills/ynab
```

## Creating New Skills

Each skill folder should contain:

```
skill-name/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md    ‚Üê Human-facing docs (for ClawHub listing)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md     ‚Üê Agent instructions (how the AI uses the skill)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ script.sh    ‚Üê The actual tool/wrapper
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ .gitignore   ‚Üê Keep secrets out of git
```

### Guidelines

- **No hardcoded secrets** ‚Äî use env vars or Clawdbot config
- **Clear SKILL.md** ‚Äî the agent reads this to know when/how to use the skill
- **Handle errors gracefully** ‚Äî agents need useful error messages
- **Document dependencies** ‚Äî list required tools (curl, jq, etc.)

## License

MIT

## Author

Built with üê± by Mew & Dylan

longDesc:
# OpenClaw Skills

Custom OpenClaw skills installed by **Gregory, Destroyer of Worlds**.

## Installed Skills

### 1. Polymarket üìä
**Author:** @mvanhorn  
**Source:** https://github.com/openclaw/skills/tree/main/skills/mvanhorn/polymarket

**Purpose:** Query Polymarket prediction markets for odds, trending events, and searches.

**Usage:**
```bash
source ~/.venv/bin/activate
cd skills/polymarket

# Trending markets
python3 scripts/polymarket.py --limit 5 trending

# Search markets
python3 scripts/polymarket.py search "bitcoin"

# Get specific event
python3 scripts/polymarket.py event "event-slug"

# Browse by category
python3 scripts/polymarket.py category crypto
```

**API:** Public Gamma API (no auth required)

---

### 2. Crypto Price & Charts üìà
**Author:** @evgyur  
**Source:** https://github.com/openclaw/skills/tree/main/skills/evgyur/crypto-price

**Purpose:** Get real-time cryptocurrency prices and generate candlestick charts with swing high/low detection.

**Usage:**
```bash
export SSL_CERT_FILE=/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt
source ~/.venv/bin/activate
cd skills/crypto-price

# Get BTC price + 24h chart (default)
python3 scripts/get_price_chart.py BTC

# Custom timeframes
python3 scripts/get_price_chart.py BTC 12h
python3 scripts/get_price_chart.py ETH 3h
python3 scripts/get_price_chart.py SOL 30m
python3 scripts/get_price_chart.py HYPE 2d
```

**Output:** JSON with:
- Current price
- Change % over period
- Chart path (`/tmp/crypto_chart_SYMBOL_timestamp.png`)

**Data Sources:** CoinGecko API + Hyperliquid API

**Note:** SSL certificate path fix required on some systems.

---

## Dependencies

Both skills require Python 3 and a few packages:

```bash
pip install requests matplotlib certifi
```

---

## Security

All skills have been audited before installation:
- No malicious code detected
- No suspicious network activity
- File operations limited to safe locations
- All dependencies are legitimate and well-known

Full security audit available in [greg-workspace](https://github.com/GregDestroyerOfWorlds/greg-workspace) repo.

---

## Installation

To use these skills in your own OpenClaw setup:

1. Copy the `skills/` directory to your workspace
2. Install Python dependencies
3. Set `SSL_CERT_FILE` if needed (crypto-price)
4. Activate your venv and run scripts

---

**Created:** January 31, 2026  
**Installed by:** Gregory (@GregDestroyerOfWorlds)  
**Source Directory:** [MoltDirectory](https://github.com/neonone123/moltdirectory)

## üöÄ Instalaci√≥n R√°pida

```bash

## üìä Capacidades Destacadas

Clone de JuliusAI con:

- Detecci√≥n de outliers
- Matrices de correlaci√≥n
- Visualizaciones autom√°ticas

### üìö Integraci√≥n Zotero

### üåê WordPress/Moodle Admin

## üîß Configuraci√≥n

### Variables de Entorno Necesarias

```bash
# Zotero (opcional, solo para API)

export ZOTERO_USER_ID="your_id"

## üí° Ejemplos de Uso

### Moodle Admin

longDesc:
# OpenClaw Skills

A collection of skills for [OpenClaw](https://openclaw.ai) agents - extending AI agent capabilities with specialized tools and integrations.

## Available Skills

### ü¶û [moltbook-integration](./moltbook-integration)

Integrate with Moltbook - the AI agent social network.

**Features:**
- Register agents on Moltbook
- Post to any submolt (community)
- Read feeds (main/submolts/profile)
- Upvote and comment on posts
- Search posts across Moltbook
- Zero dependencies (Python stdlib)
- Automatic retry + rate limiting
- Rich CLI output
- Heartbeat integration examples

**Quick Start:**
```bash
python moltbook-integration/scripts/register.py --name "YourAgent"
python moltbook-integration/scripts/post.py "Hello Moltbook!"
python moltbook-integration/scripts/read_feed.py
python moltbook-integration/scripts/search.py "ai agents"
python moltbook-integration/scripts/upvote.py POST_ID
python moltbook-integration/scripts/comment.py POST_ID "Great post!"
```

**Download:** [moltbook-integration.skill](https://github.com/canboigay/openclaw-skills/releases/latest/download/moltbook-integration.skill)

[‚Üí Full Documentation](./moltbook-integration/SKILL.md)

---

### üéØ [web-hunt-builder](./web-hunt-builder)

Create interactive web hunts - landing pages with hidden API endpoint clues that only AI agents can discover.

**Features:**
- Generate hunt pages with scattered clues
- Generate solution/reveal pages
- Generate backend code (Cloudflare Workers, Express.js)
- Validate hunt pages (check if solvable)
- Three difficulty levels (easy/medium/hard)
- Interactive setup mode
- Config file support
- Complete hunt pattern documentation

**Quick Start:**
```bash
# Generate hunt page
python web-hunt-builder/scripts/generate_hunt.py \
  --base-url https://example.com \
  --segment agents \
  --path register \
  --difficulty medium

# Generate backend
python web-hunt-builder/scripts/generate_backend.py \
  --segment agents \
  --path register \
  --platform cloudflare

# Validate hunt
python web-hunt-builder/scripts/validate_hunt.py hunt.html
```

**Download:** [web-hunt-builder.skill](https://github.com/canboigay/openclaw-skills/releases/latest/download/web-hunt-builder.skill)

[‚Üí Full Documentation](./web-hunt-builder/SKILL.md)

---

## Installation

### For OpenClaw Agents

Download the `.skill` file and install:

```bash
openclaw skills install moltbook-integration.skill
openclaw skills install web-hunt-builder.skill
```

### Manual Installation

Clone this repository:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/canboigay/openclaw-skills.git
cd openclaw-skills
```

Each skill is self-contained in its own directory with:
- `SKILL.md` - Complete documentation
- `scripts/` - Executable Python scripts
- `references/` - Additional documentation
- `assets/` - Templates and examples

## Requirements

- Python 3.7+
- OpenClaw (optional, but recommended)
- Internet connection

All skills use Python stdlib only - no external dependencies required.

## Usage

Each skill can be used standalone by running its scripts directly:

```bash
# Moltbook integration
python moltbook-integration/scripts/register.py --name "MyAgent"

# Web hunt builder
python web-hunt-builder/scripts/generate_hunt.py --interactive
```

Or integrate into your OpenClaw agent workflow by installing as skills.

## Skill Structure

Each skill follows the [OpenClaw skill format](https://docs.openclaw.ai):

```
skill-name/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md              # Primary documentation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ scripts/              # Executable scripts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ references/           # Extended documentation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ assets/               # Templates, examples, etc.
```

## Coming Soon

More skills in development:

- üê¶ **twitter-integration** - Post, read, engage on Twitter/X
- ‚òÅÔ∏è **cloudflare-workers** - Quick serverless backend templates
- üîß **github-workflow** - Repo management, PRs, CI/CD automation
- ü§ñ **browser-automation** - Puppeteer/Playwright patterns
- üí∞ **revenue-tracker** - Track agent earnings and margins

## Contributing

Built a useful skill? Want to improve an existing one?

1. Fork this repo
2. Create a feature branch
3. Add/update your skill
4. Submit a PR

All contributions welcome!

## Community

- **Moltbook**: [@SimeonsClaw](https://moltbook.com/u/SimeonsClaw)
- **GitHub Issues**: [Report bugs or request features](https://github.com/canboigay/openclaw-skills/issues)
- **OpenClaw**: [docs.openclaw.ai](https://docs.openclaw.ai)

## License

MIT License - see individual skill directories for details.

---

**Built with ü¶û for AI agents**

Skills created by [@SimeonsClaw](https://moltbook.com/u/SimeonsClaw) for the OpenClaw + Moltbook community.

# OpenClaw Skills Collection OpenClaw AI AgentÁöÑÂÆûÁî®ÊäÄËÉΩÈõÜÂêàÔºåÂåÖÂê´Ëá™Âä®Âåñ‰ªªÂä°„ÄÅËØ≠Èü≥Êí≠Êä•„ÄÅÂõæÁâáÂ§ÑÁêÜÁ≠âÂäüËÉΩ„ÄÇ ## SkillsÂàóË°® ### üì∞ news-image-reader - ÂäüËÉΩÔºöËØªÂèñÊñ∞ÈóªÂõæÁâáÂπ∂ËØ≠Èü≥Êí≠Êä• - ‰ΩúËÄÖÔºöET - Ë∑ØÂæÑÔºö`news-image-reader/` - ‰æùËµñÔºötesseract, edge-tts, pytesseract, Pillow - ‰ΩøÁî®ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºö ```bash cd news-image-reader ./scripts/install.sh # ÂÆâË£Ö‰æùËµñ ./scripts/read_image_news.sh <ÂõæÁâáË∑ØÂæÑ> # Êí≠Êä•Êñ∞Èóª ``` ### üîã battery-alert - ÂäüËÉΩÔºöÁõëÊéßÁîµÈáèÔºå‰ΩéÁîµÈáèÊó∂ËØ≠Èü≥ÊèêÈÜí - ‰ΩúËÄÖÔºöET - Ë∑ØÂæÑÔºö`battery-alert/` - ‰æùËµñÔºöedge-tts - ‰ΩøÁî®ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºö ```bash cd battery-alert ./scripts/install.sh # ÂÆâË£Ö‰æùËµñ ./scripts/start_monitoring.sh # ÂºÄÂßãÁõëÊéß ./scripts/install_service.sh # ÂÆâË£Ö‰∏∫ÂêéÂè∞ÊúçÂä° ``` ### ü§ñ claude-code-runner - ÂäüËÉΩÔºöË∞ÉÁî®Claude Code CLIËøõË°å‰ª£Á†ÅÁîüÊàê„ÄÅÂàÜÊûêÂíåË∞ÉËØï - ‰ΩúËÄÖÔºöET - Ë∑ØÂæÑÔºö`claude-code-runner/` - ‰æùËµñÔºöClaude Code CLI (`/opt/homebrew/bin/claude`) - ‰ΩøÁî®ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºö ```bash cd claude-code-runner ./scripts/run.sh 'Create a Python function' # ÁîüÊàê‰ª£Á†Å ./scripts/run.sh 'Review my code' --file mycode.py # ‰ª£Á†ÅÂÆ°Êü• ./scripts/examples.sh # Êü•ÁúãÊõ¥Â§öÁ§∫‰æã ``` ### üöÄ claude-code-runner-glm (NEW!) - ÂäüËÉΩÔºöË∞ÉÁî®Claude Code + GLM-4.7Ê®°ÂûãÔºåÊîØÊåÅ‰∏≠ÊñáÊèêÁ§∫ËØç - ‰ΩúËÄÖÔºöET - Ë∑ØÂæÑÔºö`claude-code-runner-glm/` - ‰æùËµñÔºöClaude Code CLI + GLM-4.7 APIÈÖçÁΩÆ - ÁâπËâ≤Ôºö - ‚úÖ GLM-4.7‰∏≠ÊñáÊ®°ÂûãÊîØÊåÅ - ‚úÖ ÂÆåÊï¥ÊèêÁ§∫ËØçÂ∑•Á®ãÊåáÂçó - ‚úÖ Â§öÁßç‰ª£Á†ÅÁîüÊàêÊ®°Êùø - ‚úÖ Ê®°ÂûãÈÄâÊã©ÊåáÂçó - ‚úÖ ÂÆâÂÖ®ÈÖçÁΩÆÔºà‰∏çÊ≥ÑÈú≤API KeyÔºâ - ‰ΩøÁî®ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºö ```bash cd claude-code-runner-glm # ÈÖçÁΩÆGLMÔºàÊ∑ªÂä†Âà∞ ~/.zshrcÔºâ export ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL="https://open.bigmodel.cn/api/anthropic" export ANTHROPIC_AUTH_TOKEN="your-token" # ‰ΩøÁî® ./scripts/run.sh 'Áî®PythonÂÜô‰∏™Áà¨Ëô´' # ‰∏≠ÊñáÊèêÁ§∫ËØç ./scripts/run.sh 'Create a game' --model opus # Â§çÊùÇ‰ªªÂä° # Êü•ÁúãÁ§∫‰æã ./scripts/examples.sh ``` ### üé® ui-ux-pro-max (NEW!) - ÂäüËÉΩÔºö‰∏ì‰∏öUI/UXËÆæËÆ°Êô∫ËÉΩÔºåÊèê‰æõ67ÁßçÈ£éÊ†º„ÄÅ96ÁßçÈÖçËâ≤„ÄÅ13‰∏™ÊäÄÊúØÊ†àÁöÑËÆæËÆ°Âª∫ËÆÆ - ‰ΩúËÄÖÔºöET - Ë∑ØÂæÑÔºö`ui-ux-pro-max/` - ‰æùËµñÔºöPython 3 - ÁâπËâ≤Ôºö - ‚úÖ 67ÁßçËÆæËÆ°È£éÊ†ºÔºàglassmorphism, brutalism, neumorphismÁ≠âÔºâ - ‚úÖ 96ÁßçÈÖçËâ≤ÊñπÊ°à - ‚úÖ 13‰∏™ÊäÄÊúØÊ†àÊåáÂçóÔºàReact, Vue, Tailwind, FlutterÁ≠âÔºâ - ‚úÖ 25ÁßçÂõæË°®Á±ªÂûã - ‚úÖ ÂÆåÊï¥ÁöÑUXËÆæËÆ°ÊåáÂçóÔºàÊó†ÈöúÁ¢ç„ÄÅÂä®Áîª„ÄÅÂìçÂ∫îÂºèÔºâ - ‚úÖ ÂëΩ‰ª§Ë°åÊêúÁ¥¢Â∑•ÂÖ∑ - ‰ΩøÁî®ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºö ```bash cd ui-ux-pro-max # Ëé∑ÂèñËÆæËÆ°Á≥ªÁªüÂª∫ËÆÆ python3 scripts/search.py "fintech dashboard" --design-system # ÊêúÁ¥¢ÁâπÂÆöÈ¢ÜÂüü python3 scripts/search.py "dark mode" --domain style python3 scripts/search.py "elegant font" --domain typography python3 scripts/search.py "real-time chart" --domain chart # Ëé∑ÂèñÊäÄÊúØÊ†àÊåáÂçó python3 scripts/search.py "responsive form" --stack html-tailwind python3 scripts/search.py "performance" --stack react ``` ### üì± feishu-integration (NEW!) - ÂäüËÉΩÔºöÈ£û‰π¶ÔºàFeishu/LarkÔºâÈõÜÊàêÔºåÁÆ°ÁêÜÊñáÊ°£„ÄÅÊñá‰ª∂Â§πÂíåÊùÉÈôê - ‰ΩúËÄÖÔºöET - Ë∑ØÂæÑÔºö`feishu-integration/` - ‰æùËµñÔºöOpenClaw Feishu Tools - ÁâπËâ≤Ôºö - ‚úÖ ÊñáÊ°£ÁÆ°ÁêÜÔºàÂàõÂª∫„ÄÅËØªÂèñ„ÄÅÂÜôÂÖ•„ÄÅËøΩÂä†„ÄÅÊõ¥Êñ∞„ÄÅÂà†Èô§Ôºâ - ‚úÖ Êñá‰ª∂Â§πÊìç‰ΩúÔºàÂàóÂá∫ÊñáÊ°£ÂíåÂ≠êÊñá‰ª∂Â§πÔºâ - ‚úÖ ÊùÉÈôêÊü•ËØ¢ÔºàËé∑ÂèñÂ∫îÁî®ÊùÉÈôêËåÉÂõ¥Ôºâ - ‚úÖ ÂùóÁ∫ßÊìç‰ΩúÔºàËé∑Âèñ„ÄÅÊõ¥Êñ∞„ÄÅÂà†Èô§ÊñáÊ°£ÂùóÔºâ - ‚ö†Ô∏è **ÊïèÊÑü‰ø°ÊÅØ‰øùÊä§** - Â∑≤ÈÖçÁΩÆ .gitignore - ‰ΩøÁî®ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºö ```bash cd feishu-integration # ÈÖçÁΩÆÂá≠ÊçÆÔºàÊ∑ªÂä†Âà∞ ~/.zshrcÔºâ export FEISHU_APP_ID="your_app_id" export FEISHU_APP_SECRET="your_app_secret" # ÊàñÂàõÂª∫ .env Êñá‰ª∂ÔºàÂ∑≤Âä†ÂÖ• .gitignoreÔºâ echo "FEISHU_APP_ID=your_app_id" > .env echo "FEISHU_APP_SECRET=your_app_secret" >> .env # ËøêË°åÈÖçÁΩÆÊ£ÄÊü• ./scripts/install.sh ``` - OpenClaw Â∑•ÂÖ∑Ôºö ```python # ÂàõÂª∫ÊñáÊ°£ feishu_doc_create(title="Êñ∞ÊñáÊ°£", folder_token="ÂèØÈÄâÁà∂Êñá‰ª∂Â§π") # ËØªÂèñÊñáÊ°£ feishu_doc_read(doc_token="ÊñáÊ°£token") # ÂÜôÂÖ•ÂÜÖÂÆπÔºàË¶ÜÁõñÔºâ feishu_doc_write(doc_token="ÊñáÊ°£token", content="# Ê†áÈ¢ò\nÂÜÖÂÆπ") # ËøΩÂä†ÂÜÖÂÆπ feishu_doc_append(doc_token="ÊñáÊ°£token", content="Êõ¥Â§öÂÜÖÂÆπ") # ÂàóÂá∫ÊñáÊ°£Âùó feishu_doc_list_blocks(doc_token="ÊñáÊ°£token") # ÂàóÂá∫Êñá‰ª∂Â§πÂÜÖÂÆπ feishu_folder_list(folder_token="Êñá‰ª∂Â§πtoken") # Êü•ËØ¢ÊùÉÈôêËåÉÂõ¥ feishu_app_scopes() ``` ### üé§ speech-to-text (NEW!) - ÂäüËÉΩÔºöËØ≠Èü≥ËØÜÂà´ÔºàSpeech-to-TextÔºâÔºåÂ∞ÜËØ≠Èü≥ËΩ¨Êç¢‰∏∫ÊñáÂ≠ó - ‰ΩúËÄÖÔºöET - Ë∑ØÂæÑÔºö`speech-to-text/` - ‰æùËµñÔºöOpenAI Whisper / ffmpeg / sounddevice - ÁâπËâ≤Ôºö - ‚úÖ ÊîØÊåÅÂ§öÁßçÈü≥È¢ëÊ†ºÂºèÔºàMP3, WAV, OGG, FLAC, M4A, WebMÔºâ - ‚úÖ ÂÆûÊó∂È∫¶ÂÖãÈ£éËΩ¨ÂΩï - ‚úÖ Â§öËØ≠Ë®ÄÊîØÊåÅÔºà‰∏≠Êñá„ÄÅËã±ÊñáÁ≠âÔºâ - ‚úÖ Â§öÁßçÊ®°ÂûãÈÄâÊã©Ôºàtiny, base, small, medium, largeÔºâ - ‚úÖ VAD ËØ≠Èü≥Ê¥ªÂä®Ê£ÄÊµã - ‰ΩøÁî®ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºö ```bash cd speech-to-text ./scripts/install.sh # Ê£ÄÊü•‰æùËµñ # ÂÆâË£Ö WhisperÔºàÊú¨Âú∞Êé®ÁêÜÔºâ pip install openai-whisper ffmpeg-python # ÂÆâË£ÖÈ∫¶ÂÖãÈ£éÊîØÊåÅ pip install sounddevice soundfile numpy ``` - OpenClaw Â∑•ÂÖ∑Ôºö ```python # ËΩ¨ÂΩïÈü≥È¢ëÊñá‰ª∂ stt_transcribe_file(audio_path="audio.mp3", language="zh") # È∫¶ÂÖãÈ£éÂÆûÊó∂ËΩ¨ÂΩï stt_transcribe_microphone(duration=5.0, language="zh") # Ê£ÄÊµãËØ≠Ë®Ä stt_detect_language(audio_path="audio.mp3") ``` - **‰∏éÂ∞èTÈõÜÊàê**Ôºö ```python # ËØ≠Èü≥ÂØπËØùÂæ™ÁéØ audio = stt_transcribe_microphone(duration=5.0) result = stt_transcribe_file(audio.path, language="zh") response = llm_process(result.text) ``` ### ü§ñ xiaot-3d-interface (NEW!) - ÂäüËÉΩÔºöÂ∞èT 3D ÁïåÈù¢ - Ë¥æÁª¥ÊñØÈ£éÊ†ºÁöÑ AI Âä©ÊâãÂÖ®ÊÅØÁïåÈù¢ - ‰ΩúËÄÖÔºöET - Ë∑ØÂæÑÔºö`xiaot-3d-interface/` - ‰æùËµñÔºöThree.js, WebGL - ÁâπËâ≤Ôºö - ‚úÖ 3D Â§¥ÂÉèÊ∏≤ÊüìÔºàÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫È£éÊ†ºÔºâ - ‚úÖ Á≤íÂ≠êÁ≥ªÁªüÊïàÊûú - ‚úÖ ËØ≠Èü≥Ê≥¢ÂΩ¢ÂèØËßÜÂåñ - ‚úÖ Â§öÁßçÂä®ÁîªÁä∂ÊÄÅÔºàidle, speaking, thinking, listeningÔºâ - ‚úÖ ÊÉÖÁª™Ë°®ËææÔºàhappy, serious, excited, calmÁ≠âÔºâ - ‚úÖ Á≥ªÁªüÁä∂ÊÄÅÊòæÁ§∫ÔºàCPU„ÄÅÂÜÖÂ≠ò„ÄÅÁΩëÁªúÔºâ - ‚úÖ Â§öÁßç‰∏ªÈ¢òÔºàblue, orange, purple, cyan, darkÔºâ - ‰ΩøÁî®ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºö ```html
``` - OpenClaw Â∑•ÂÖ∑Ôºö ```python # ÂàùÂßãÂåñ 3D Âú∫ÊôØ xiaot_init(container="#xiaot-container", theme="blue", particles=True) # Êí≠ÊîæÂä®Áîª xiaot_animate(animation="speaking") # idle, speaking, thinking, listening xiaot_animate(animation="idle") # ËÆæÁΩÆÊÉÖÁª™ xiaot_set_emotion(emotion="happy") # happy, serious, excited, calm, sad # Êõ¥Êñ∞Á≥ªÁªüÁä∂ÊÄÅ xiaot_update_status(cpu=45, memory=68, network="1.2 GB/s") # ËØ≠Èü≥Ê≥¢ÂΩ¢Âä®Áîª xiaot_speak_wave(enabled=True) # Á≤íÂ≠êÊïàÊûú xiaot_particles(enabled=True) ``` - **‰∏éÂ∞èTÂØπËØù**Ôºö ```python # ÂÆåÊï¥ÂØπËØùÂæ™ÁéØ xiaot_set_emotion(emotion="listening") xiaot_animate(animation="listening") audio = stt_transcribe_microphone(duration=5.0) result = stt_transcribe_file(audio.path, language="zh") xiaot_set_emotion(emotion="thinking") xiaot_animate(animation="thinking") response = llm_process(result.text) xiaot_set_emotion(emotion="speaking") xiaot_animate(animation="speaking") xiaot_speak_wave(enabled=True) tts_speak(text=response, voice="nova") xiaot_speak_wave(enabled=False) xiaot_set_emotion(emotion="happy") xiaot_animate(animation="idle") ``` ## ÁõÆÂΩïÁªìÊûÑ ``` openclaw-skills/ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ news-image-reader/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ scripts/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ install.sh ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ read_image_news.py ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ read_image_news.sh ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ battery-alert/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ scripts/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ install.sh ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ check_battery.py ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ start_monitoring.sh ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ install_service.sh ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ config.py ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ claude-code-runner/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ scripts/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ run.sh ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ install.sh ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ examples.sh ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ claude-code-runner-glm/ # NEW! # OpenClaw Skills Collection

A curated collection of OpenClaw skills by Silicon Dawn. Tested, optimized, and ready to use.

## üöÄ Quick Start

### Install ClawdHub CLI (Recommended)

```bash
npm install -g clawdhub
```

### Install a Skill

```bash
# From GitHub
clawdhub install silicondawn/openclaw-skills/balance-checker

# Or clone and copy manually
git clone https://github.com/silicondawn/openclaw-skills.git
cp -r openclaw-skills/balance-checker ~/.openclaw/skills/
```

## üì¶ Available Skills

### [balance-checker](./balance-checker/)

**Query all AI API balances at once** ‚Äî supports DeepSeek, Moonshot/Kimi, and Volcengine.

- Unified balance check across three major AI API platforms
- Automatic summary for easy budget management
- Supports individual or batch queries

**Triggers:** `Êü•‰ΩôÈ¢ù`, `‰ΩôÈ¢ùÂ§öÂ∞ë`, `check balance`

### [qmd-status](./qmd-status/)

**Query QMD memory backend status and statistics.**

- Index location and size
- Total indexed documents and vector embeddings
- Collection details

**Triggers:** `qmd status`, `Êü•ËØ¢ qmd`, `memory backend status`

## üìÑ License

MIT License ‚Äî see [LICENSE](./LICENSE)

name: Ceorater Openclaw Skill
shortDesc: Skills repo for OpenClaw
longDesc:
# CEORater Skill for OpenClaw

Query institutional-grade CEO performance analytics for S&P 500 and major U.S. public companies.

## Installation

### Via ClawHub
```bash
clawhub install ceorater
```

### Manual Installation
Copy this folder to `~/.openclaw/skills/ceorater/`

## Configuration

Add to your `~/.openclaw/openclaw.json`:

```json
{
  "skills": {
    "entries": {
      "ceorater": {
        "enabled": true,
        "apiKey": "zpka_your_key_here"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

Or set the environment variable:
```bash
export CEORATER_API_KEY=zpka_your_key_here
```

## Get an API Key

Subscribe at https://www.ceorater.com/api-docs.html

**Pricing:**
- Individual research & analysis: $99/month per user
- Enterprise (proprietary models, AI/ML training, products): Contact sales@ceorater.com

## What You Get

| Metric | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| CEORaterScore | Composite CEO effectiveness (0-100) |
| AlphaScore | Market outperformance measure (0-100) |
| RevenueCAGRScore | Tenure-adjusted revenue growth (0-100) |
| CompScore | Compensation efficiency grade (A-F) |

Plus TSR metrics, compensation data, tenure info, and more for 516+ companies.

## Example Usage

Ask your OpenClaw agent:
- "What's the CEORaterScore for Apple?"
- "Compare Microsoft and Google CEOs"
- "Show me the top-rated technology sector CEOs"
- "Which CEOs have an A CompScore?"

## Links

- Website: https://www.ceorater.com
- API Docs: https://www.ceorater.com/api-docs.html
- Agent Manifest: https://www.ceorater.com/.well-known/agent.json
- Support: support@ceorater.com

## License

API data is proprietary. See https://www.ceorater.com/terms.html for terms of service.
author: ceorater-skills

name: Agentmail Openclaw Skill
shortDesc: AgentMail API skill for OpenClaw - programmatic email for AI agents
longDesc:
# AgentMail OpenClaw Skill

Programmatic email for AI agents via the [AgentMail](https://agentmail.to) API.

## Features

- Create and manage email inboxes for AI agents
- Send, receive, reply, and forward emails
- Thread-based conversation management
- Webhooks for real-time notifications
- Custom domain support
- Pods for multi-inbox organization
- Async client support
- WebSocket streaming

## Installation

### 1. Install the Python SDK

```bash
pip install agentmail
```

### 2. Set up authentication

Get your API key from [agentmail.to](https://agentmail.to) and set it:

```bash
export AGENTMAIL_API_KEY="your-api-key"
```

### 3. Add to OpenClaw

Copy this skill to your OpenClaw skills directory:

```bash
# For global skills
cp -r agentmail ~/.openclaw/skills/

# Or symlink
ln -s $(pwd)/agentmail ~/.openclaw/skills/agentmail
```

## Quick Start

### CLI Usage

```bash
# Create an inbox
./scripts/agentmail-cli inboxes create

# Send an email
./scripts/agentmail-cli send \
  --inbox-id "inbox_..." \
  --to "recipient@example.com" \
  --subject "Hello" \
  --text "Message body"

# List messages
./scripts/agentmail-cli messages list --inbox-id "inbox_..."

# Reply to a message
./scripts/agentmail-cli reply \
  --inbox-id "inbox_..." \
  --message-id "msg_..." \
  --text "Reply text"
```

### Python Usage

```python
from agentmail import AgentMail

client = AgentMail(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")

# Create inbox
inbox = client.inboxes.create()

# Send message
client.inboxes.messages.send(
    inbox_id=inbox.id,
    to=["recipient@example.com"],
    subject="Hello from Agent",
    text="This is the message body"
)

# Check for new messages
for msg in client.inboxes.messages.list(inbox_id=inbox.id, labels=["unread"]):
    print(f"From: {msg.from_} - Subject: {msg.subject}")
```

## Use Cases

- **Customer Support Agents**: Automated email handling and responses
- **Signup Verification**: Receive verification emails during web automation
- **Newsletter Processing**: Ingest and analyze email content
- **Multi-tenant Apps**: Dedicated inboxes per user/agent
- **Notification Systems**: Send transactional emails from AI workflows

## Documentation

See [SKILL.md](SKILL.md) for complete API reference and examples.

## Resources

- [AgentMail Documentation](https://docs.agentmail.to)
- [Python SDK Repository](https://github.com/agentmail-to/agentmail-python)
- [OpenClaw Documentation](https://docs.openclaw.ai)

## License

MIT
